intro: Arnebia hispidissima, commonly known as the hairy arnebia, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, bright red or pink flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid soils and is adapted to dry climates. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, contributing to its common name. Arnebia hispidissima is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant blooms and hardy nature.
